page.title: 03Upottery's Farming Methods
page.content: In the olden days farmers used Shire horses and scythes.They had steam tractors and they had knives to cut the crops. They had carts too. And it was a long day for them. In the olden days they used horses to plough the fields and they had carts instead of the trailers and tractors of today. They used knives to cut the corn and it took them about one whole day to cut it. Today the farmer uses many different machines to help him in his work.The tractor has replaced the horse and pulls the agricultural machinery for preparing land ,sowing crops,tending them and harvesting . One farmer still sows a small section by hand as it is too steep for machinery. Machines also help in other work too like milking a dairy herd.
